docs.lead_paragraph: George Foreman Cooking is introducing an elaborate, $3 million marketing campaign that uses a weight-loss contest to promote the grill brand’s appliances.

headline.seo: George Foreman Grills Advertised Through Weight-Loss Contest
headline.main: Promoting Foreman Grills With a Weight-Loss Contest
headline.print_headline: Promoting Foreman Grills With a Weight-Loss Contest

docs.abstract: Jane L Levere Advertising column; Spectrum Brands is introducing elaborate, $3 million marketing campaign that uses weight-loss contest to promote George Foreman brand of grills.
docs.snippet: George Foreman Cooking is introducing an elaborate, $3 million marketing campaign that uses a weight-loss contest to promote the grill brand’s appliances.

headline.main: In a Weak Market for Mergers and Acquisitions, Signs of Strength
headline.print_headline: Some Signs of Strength in Mergers and Acquisitions as a Weak Year Ends

docs.abstract: Four years after the financial crisis nearly shut down the markets, the mergers business has been slow to return to the heights it attained before 2008.
docs.snippet: Four years after the financial crisis nearly shut down the markets, the mergers business has been slow to return to the heights it attained before 2008.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

docs.lead_paragraph: Tattler’s Jet, a 14-year-old Midwestern folk hero with 120 victories, will be at Monticello Raceway on Thursday to cap his harness racing career.

headline.seo: Tattler’s Jet Visits New York for His Last Stand
headline.main: After 460 Starts, a War Horse’s Last Stand

docs.abstract: Tattler’s Jet, 14-year-old pacer with 120 victories, will compete at Monticello Raceway in upstate New York to cap his harness racing career; has averaged 40 starts per year during his nine years with trainer Gene Miller.
docs.snippet: Tattler’s Jet, a 14-year-old Midwestern folk hero with 120 victories, will be at Monticello Raceway on Thursday to cap his harness racing career.

docs.lead_paragraph: Testing devices for tracking food intake and physical activity.

headline.seo: Devices to Monitor Physical Activity and Food Intake
headline.main: An Appetite for Weight Management Tools

docs.abstract: Several devices and applications designed to help users track their calorie intake and output are on the market, and some are better than others.
docs.snippet: Testing devices for tracking food intake and physical activity.

docs.lead_paragraph: The share of 2-to-4-year-olds who were obese declined to 14.9 percent in 2010, down from 15.2 percent in 2003.

headline.main: Study Finds Modest Declines in Obesity Rates Among Young Children From Poor Families
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Modest Declines in Obesity Rates Among Young Children From Poor Families

docs.abstract: Study at Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, published in Journal of American Medical Assn, finds that share of obese children from poor families declined to 14.9 percent in 2010, from 15.2 percent in 2003; rate had risen between 1998 and 2003; researchers say dip may indicate obesity epidemic has passed its peak among this group.
docs.snippet: The share of 2-to-4-year-olds who were obese declined to 14.9 percent in 2010, down from 15.2 percent in 2003.

keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Chicken farms including Bell & Evans in Pennsylvania are using oregano-based products as substitutes for antibiotics, but research on their effectiveness is scant and many remain skeptical.

headline.seo: Chicken Farms Try Oregano as Antibiotic Substitute
headline.main: In Hopes of Healthier Chickens, Farms Turn to Oregano
headline.print_headline: In Hopes of Healthier Chickens, a Pennsylvania Company Adds Oregano to the Diet

docs.abstract: Chicken farms like Bell & Evans in Pennsylvania are using oregano-based products as substitutes for antibiotics, but research on their effectiveness is scant and many health care experts remain skeptical; sales in United States of organic meat, poultry and fish were small part of food market in 2011, totaling $538 million.
docs.snippet: Chicken farms including Bell & Evans in Pennsylvania are using oregano-based products as substitutes for antibiotics, but research on their effectiveness is scant and many remain skeptical.

docs.abstract: Among poor children, being overweight is a much greater problem than hunger. Food stamps should not be paying for soda.
docs.snippet: Among poor children, being overweight is a much greater problem than hunger. Food stamps should not be paying for soda.

headline.print_headline: 7-Eleven Shifts Focus to Healthier Food Options

docs.snippet: The convenience store chain turned to fresh foods to offset increased competition from other outlets and declines in cigarette sales.

docs.lead_paragraph: Robert Doar, the New York City human resources commissioner, and two City Council members, including the speaker, Christine C. Quinn, respond to an editorial.

headline.main: Getting Food Aid to Storm-Ravaged New Yorkers
headline.print_headline: Getting Food Aid to Storm-Ravaged New Yorkers

docs.abstract: Letter from New York City Council speaker Christine C Quinn and Annabel Palma, chairwoman of council's General Welfare Committee, comments on Dec 17 editorial on New York City's food assistance response after Hurricane Sandy.
docs.snippet: Robert Doar, the New York City human resources commissioner, and two City Council members, including the speaker, Christine C. Quinn, respond to an editorial.

headline.main: How Much Milk Should Children Drink?
headline.print_headline: Nutrition: Putting Numbers to Children’s Milk Needs

docs.abstract: Researchers have established that for most children, drinking two cups a day achieves the right balance for vitamin D and iron.
docs.snippet: Researchers have established that for most children, drinking two cups a day achieves the right balance for vitamin D and iron.
